In light of the increased risk of transmission in crowded and often unsanitary jails and prisons, some jurisdictions have taken steps to reduce the number of people entering those facilities, and, in some cases, to release some individuals currently being incarcerated.
13 The vast majority of these individuals are being held awaiting trial or after being convicted of minor, non-violent crimes. Likewise, some police departments have reduced or entirely stopped making custodial arrests for low-level crimes such as loitering and public intoxication.
